name: Super Bowl II Quiz | Super Bowl  1960s | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which team won Super Bowl II?
questions.explanation:
Green Bay Packers.

	The Green Bay Packers from the NFL beat the Raiders from the AFL by a score of 33-14.

questions.text: Which AFL team did Oakland defeat in their Conference Championship to gain a trip to Super Bowl II?
questions.explanation:
Houston Oilers.

	Oakland finished the regular season with an amazing 13-1 record. Their only loss was to the New York Jets.  They defeated the Oilers 40-7 in the Conference Championship.

questions.text: Who was the MVP for Super Bowl II?
questions.explanation:
Bart Starr.

	After a questionable regular season of 9 touchdowns and 17 interceptions, the veteran QB Bart Starr threw for 202 yards with a touchdown and 0 interceptions in the Super Bowl.

questions.text: Which player scored first in the game?
questions.explanation:
Don Chandler.

	Don Chandler kicked a field goal for the Packers on their first possession of the game. Oakland was forced to punt on their first two possessions.

questions.text: Where was the second Super Bowl held?
questions.explanation:
Miami.

	It was held at the Orange Bowl in Miami. The game time was 3:00pm EST on January 14, 1968. It was the first of at least 10 Super Bowls in Miami.

questions.text: Who was Green Bay's leading receiver in the game?
questions.explanation:
Carroll Dale.

	Dale caught 4 passes for 43 yards. Miller was the leading receiver for Oakland.

questions.text: Green Bay running back Donnie Anderson also played what other position in the game?
questions.explanation:
Punter.

	Anderson punted 6 times in the game for an average of 39.0 yards per punt.

questions.text: Which player caught both passing touchdowns for the Raiders?
questions.explanation:
Bill Miller.

	Miller caught 2 touchdowns from QB Daryle Lamonica. Those were the only scores for Oakland in the game. Both were 23-yard touchdowns.

questions.text: Who was leading at halftime and by how much?
options: The game was tied at halftime
questions.explanation:
Green Bay by 9.

	Green Bay led 16-7 at halftime. The half closed out with a 43-yard field goal by Green Bay kicker Don Chandler.

questions.text: Green Bay rushed for more yards in the game than Oakland.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The Raiders from the air were 15-34-208-2-1, while the Packers were 13-24-202-1.  Oakland rushed 20-107, with the Packers rushing 41-160.
